CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1970, pg. 6 reads: "The Processi[o]n Moves To Israel - One of the most artistic displays, which transposed sections of the Educational Building of Mt. Olive Baptist Church, Rankin, into a veritable Assembly of United Nations on Sunday, Feb. 15 was the area symbolizing life in Israel. Rabbi Walter Jacobs, fifth from left, featured speaker for the International Tea, congratulates the chairman, Mable Lewis, and the hostesses for the authentic display, including the table set for the Feast of the Passover.  Mrs. Hilda Logan, second from left, and Mrs. Virginia Goggins, second from right, were hostesses responsible for Israel.  Others in picture are, left to right, Sherida D. Scarbrough and Mary Jane Page, the Hon. Matthew Furjanic, Rankin's mayor, and Mrs. Brannon J. Hopson, wife of the pastor of the church, who was unable to attend because of illness. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Sherida D. Scarbrough, Hilda Logan, Mary Jane Page, Rankin mayor Matthew Furjanic, Rabbi Walter Jacobs, Mable Lewis, Virginia Goggins, and possibly Mrs. Brannon J. Hopson, standing around Israel table for International tea in Mt. Olive Baptist Church, Rankin
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Women--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Posters--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Suits (Clothing)--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Dresses--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Interiors--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Mt. Olive Baptist Church--Pennsylvania--Rankin.Logan, Hilda.Page, Mary Jane Mitchell.
